benchmark_details.name: CodeFlowBench
benchmark_details.overview: CodeFlowBench is the first benchmark designed to comprehensively evaluate LLMs’ ability to perform codeflow – implementing new functionality by reusing existing functions over multiple turns. It comprises 5,258 problems from Codeforces and features a dual assessment protocol and structural metrics.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the multi-turn, iterative code generation capabilities for codeflow settings in LLMs.

data.annotation: Automatically verified through an automated pipeline.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the success of code generation at specific turns and their depth complexity.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values in metrics indicate better performance in multi-turn scenarios.
methodology.baseline_results: Closed-source models and various configurations of open-source models were tested.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments were carried out on 1,000 selected problems.
